DOC.brief_summary: Computer Aided Surgery in total knee arthroplasty improves knee stability and functional outcomes more than conventional total knee arthroplasty.
DOC.brief_title: Computer Aided Gap Balancing Improves Sagittal Stability and Outcomes for Cruciate-Retaining Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: The success of total knee arthroplasty depends on restoration of limb alignment, precise implant positioning and optimal gap balancing. The advent of computer aided surgery (CAS) has improved limb alignment and implant positioning. The objective of this study was to evaluate the functional outcome of computer aided soft tissue gap balancing in total knee arthroplasty.
DOC.criteria: primary osteoarthritis of the knee rheumatoid arthritis, previous knee surgery, infection and those who could not be treated with unconstrained cruciate retaining TKA and a short stem tibial implant
